Q: pip install mysqlclient returns "fatal error C1083: Cannot open file: 'mysql.h': No such file or directory A:

from 2025
version mysqlclient==2.2.7
got to https://downloads.mariadb.com/Connectors/c/connector-c-3.0.4/
install it
install will be in C:\Program Files\MariaDB\MariaDB Connector C 64-bit
go there and copy include folder

go to C:\ folder
create folder: mariadb-connector
paste include in C:\mariadb-connector

good luck

Q: Cross-thread mutation with Task - is it allowed? A:

Is there something in the async/await that sets up memory barrier and actually ensures the code works?

Yes (if a thread switch occurred when continuing). This isn't officially documented anywhere AFAIK, but tons of async code depends on it.

In the general case, local variables are lifted into the state machine and potentially live on the heap. So even in the case of local variable access before and after an await, memory barriers would be necessary.

Again, this isn't documented AFAIK, but async would be pretty useless without it.
